value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kAniA_N7sB8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Formula engine and storage engine in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the differences between the formula engine and the storage engine is the first step to understand the performance metrics and optimize a DAX formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684038?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: How to return 0 instead of BLANK in DAX
value.excerpt: How to force a measure to return zero instead of blank, in order to highlight combinations of attributes with no data.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/713576?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Optimizing nested iterators in DAX
value.excerpt: Possible optimization approaches to improve the performance of nested iterators in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/70755/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using KEEPFILTERS in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains how to use KEEPFILTERS to intersect instead of overriding an existing filter context in DAX. Using FEEPFILTERS simplifies the code and improves performance. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751682?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Add DAX calculation groups to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: Learn how you can add many similar measures to your model.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You'll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you'll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #13: EARLIER

Link to pbix and excel file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/earlier-dax  EARLIER is mostly used in the context of calculated columns.  The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations

value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create
